Definition.Description: Challenge Meter based maintenance is costly and introduces additional failure risks in complex equipment. Even with maintenance, it is critical to monitor and detect early sign of failure to prevent significant impacts. Autoclaves are a critical part of commercial GMP operations. Unplanned downtime can ripple through a plant. Solution Leverage
Definition.Document:
Drift Detection and Modeling

Challenge

Meter based maintenance is costly and introduces additional failure risks in complex equipment. Even with maintenance, it is critical to monitor and detect early sign of failure to prevent significant impacts.

Autoclaves are a critical part of commercial GMP operations. Unplanned downtime can ripple through a plant.

Solution

Leverage Seeq to model the equipment's operations in real-time. Use the models to detect early signs of failure or drift. Reduce failures and make data-driven decisions.

Model an autoclaves DP during a pressure hold test to detect drift and alert of early signs of integrity issues. 

Operation Identification

Bring in relevant data and event based conditions. Add any additional context and pre-process the signals as needed.

  • Signal Data
  • Identify Operations

Focus on the vacuum test and PHT lull period withing the test to detect abnormal pressure changes, which could indicate early signs of a PHT failures and or equipment issues. 

  • Vacuum Test

Note: Typically the maximum allowable DP over the lull is ~2kPa. This threshold varies depending on the specific vendor and validation.

  • PHT Lull

Golden Profiles

Select ideal vs other cycles from historical data to train the statistical reference profiles.

  • Clean PHT Selection

Build the statistical reference profiles using the ideal historical PHT datasets. Overlay the upper, lower, and average profiles.

  • Overlay PHT Profiles

Monitor for PHT Deviations

Detect any deviations during the PHT using the upper and lower statistical limits as the boundaries. Configure notifications to alert.

  • PHT Deviation

Model Pressure Drift: Predict Failure 

Predict pressure drift during the PHT to identify when the DP exceeds the threshold. Notify of DP drift

  • Prediction

Drift Detection and Modeling

Challenge

Meter based maintenance is costly and introduces additional failure risks in complex equipment. Even with maintenance, it is critical to  monitor and detect early sign of failure to prevent any significant impacts.

Autoclaves are a critical part of commercial GMP operations. Unplanned downtime can ripple through a plant.

Solution

Leverage Seeq to model the equipment's operations in real-time. Use the models to detect earl signs of failure or drift. Reduce failures and make data-driven decisions.

Model an autoclaves DP during a pressure hold test to detect drift and alert of early signs of integrity issues. 

Operation Identification

Bring in relevant data and event based conditions. Add any additional context and pre-process the signals as needed.Mar 13, 2023 9:01 AM - Mar 21, 2023 4:11 PM

Mar 13, 2023 9:01 AM - Mar 21, 2023 4:11 PM

  • Signal Data
  • Identify Operations

Focus on the vacuum test and PHT lull period withing the test to detect abnormal pressure changes, which could indicate early signs of a PHT failures and or equipment issues. 

  • Vacuum Test

Note: Typically the maximum allowable DP over the lull is ~2kPa. This threshold varies depending on the specific vendor and validation.

  • PHT Lull

 

Ideal PHT Selection

Select the ideal PHTs from historical data to be used to as training periods to create statistical reference profiles. We can overlay the PHT capsules to compare the selected clean vs other cycles.

  • Clean PHT Selection

Golden Profiles **Consider smoothing

Build the statistical reference profiles using the ideal historical PHT datasets as training periods. An upper, lower, and average limit are overlaid.

  • Overlay PHT Profiles

Monitor for PHT Deviations

Detect any deviations during the PHT using the upper and lower statistical limits as the boundaries. Configure notifications to alert.

  • PHT Deviations

Model Pressure Drift: Predict Failure 

Predict pressure drift during the PHT to identify when the DP exceeds the threshold. Notify of DP drift

  • Prediction

**If the DP is shofin an upward drift, step into the future to see where the DP is predicted to exceed the threshold.

Drift Detection and Modeling

Challenge

Meter based maintenance is costly and introduces additional failure risks in complex equipment. Even with maintenance, it is critical to  monitor and detect early sign of failure to prevent any significant impacts.

Model an autoclaves DP during a pressure hold test to detect drift and alert of early signs of integrity issues. 

Operation Identification

Bring in relevant data and event based conditions. Add any additional context and pre-process the signals as needed.

  • Signal Data
  • Identify Operations  

Identify the Vacuum Test cycles. The PHT lull period will be focused on to detect abnormal pressure changes which could indicate potential PHT failures and subsequently equipment issues. 

  • Vacuum Test

Typically the maximum allowable DP over the lull is ~2kPa. This threshold varies depending on the specific vendor and validation.

  • PHT Lull

Ideal PHT Selection

Select the ideal PHTs from historical data to be used to as training periods to create statistical reference profiles. We can overlay the PHT capsules to compare the selected clean vs other cycles.

  • Clean PHT Selection

Golden Profiles **Consider smoothing

Build the statistical reference profiles using the ideal historical PHT datasets as training periods. An upper, lower, and average limit are overlaid. 

  • Overlay PHT and Limits

Monitor for PHT Deviations

Detect any deviations during the PHT using the upper and lower statistical limits as the boundaries. Configure notifications to alert.

  • PHT Deviations
